docs.snippet: Michael Weiner served just under four years as the head of the baseball players union, but made an indelible mark, earning praise for his kindness, intelligence and compassion....
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Weiner served just under four years as the head of the baseball players union, but made an indelible mark, earning praise for his kindness, intelligence and compassion.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column honors Michael Weiner, who served just under four years as the head of Major League Baseball Players Association, but made an indelible mark, earning praise for his kindness, intelligence and compassion; Weiner had died, at age 51, after a 15-month fight with brain cancer.

headline.print_headline: A Leader Who Knew How to Make ‘Every Player Feel Important’

docs.snippet: Mr. Weiner forged agreements with baseball club owners that enhanced drug testing and brought years of labor peace to the game after decades of strife....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Weiner forged agreements with baseball club owners that enhanced drug testing and brought years of labor peace to the game after decades of strife.
docs.abstract: Michael Weiner, executive director of the Major League Baseball Players Assn who forged agreements that enhanced drug testing and brought decades of labor peace, dies at age 51.

headline.main: Michael Weiner, Peacemaking Leader of Baseball Union, Dies at 51
headline.print_headline: Michael Weiner, 51, Dies; Headed Baseball Union

docs.snippet: The Kansas City Royals agreed to a four-year, $32 million contract with the left-hander Jason Vargas, trying to fill the void in their rotation created by Ervin Santana’s free agency....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Kansas City Royals agreed to a four-year, $32 million contract with the left-hander Jason Vargas, trying to fill the void in their rotation created by Ervin Santana’s free agency.
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals agree to a four-year, $32 million contract with left-hander Jason Vargas, trying to fill the void in their rotation created by Ervin Santana’s free agency.

docs.snippet: The noise Alex Rodriguez and his team have been making has been successful in diverting attention from accusations that he used drugs to an investigation he says has been abusive....
docs.lead_paragraph: The noise Alex Rodriguez and his team have been making has been successful in diverting attention from accusations that he used drugs to an investigation he says has been abusive.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column; noise Alex Rodriguez and his team have been making has been successful in diverting focus from accusations that he used drugs to the investigation itself, which he says has been abusive; holds that without any evidence for the public to examine, as in a trial, noise from a noisy Rodriguez is all there is to discuss.

docs.snippet: A congressional hearing on Thursday focused on legislation that would give the United States Anti-Doping Agency the authority to set and enforce antidoping standards in the sport....
docs.lead_paragraph: A congressional hearing on Thursday focused on legislation that would give the United States Anti-Doping Agency the authority to set and enforce antidoping standards in the sport.
docs.abstract: Congressional hearing focuses on Horseracing Integrity and Safety Act, which would give United States Anti-Doping Agency authority to set and enforce federal antidoping standards in troubled sport of thoroughbred racing.

headline.main: Witnesses at Hearing Urge Congress to Enlist Antidoping Agency and Save Horse Racing
headline.print_headline: Witnesses at Hearing Urge Congress to Enlist Antidoping Agency and Save a Sport

docs.snippet: Promoting the American version of the TV trivia-game show “The Chase,” a British champion sampled a range of contests at bars in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens....
docs.lead_paragraph: Promoting the American version of the TV trivia-game show “The Chase,” a British champion sampled a range of contests at bars in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens.
docs.abstract: British trivia expert Mark Labbett visits several New York City bars for quiz nights to promote GSN game show The Chase.
